DOC.brief_summary: The primary aim study demonstrate blood ion level ( cobalt chromium ) low one year patient receive metal polyethylene total hip compare CONSERVE® A-Class Total Hip BFH® technology . Secondary aim include gather clinical data regard survival dislocation rate two year post surgery , well assessment pain , physical function , radiographic clinical outcome two year interval .
DOC.brief_title: RCT Comparing Ion Levels Clinical Outcomes A-Class BFH Metal Polyethylene Total Hip Replacement
DOC.criteria: Individuals undergo unilateral total hip replacement . Patients 50 70 year age . Patients previously undergone type joint replacement . Patients evidence active infection . Patients document allergy cobalt chromium molybdenum .
DOC.keyword: Individuals undergo unilateral total hip replacement .
